Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class EditorCommands

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.EditorCommands
public class EditorCommands extends Object
Defines the set of built-in commands supported by the editor. This class also defines some static helper methods that are useful when implementing new commands.
Since:
3.0

    • BEGIN_COMPOUND_EDIT

      public static final ActionListener BEGIN_COMPOUND_EDIT
      Begins a compound edit. Following commands will be grouped together until a subsequent END_COMPOUND_EDIT. The group will be treated as a single command when applying an undo or redo.

    • END_COMPOUND_EDIT

      public static final ActionListener END_COMPOUND_EDIT
      Ends a previous begun compound edit.

  • Method Details

    • insertBracketingText

      public static void insertBracketingText​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, String prefix, String suffix)
      An action helper function that inserts a block of text specified by suffix and prefix around the selection. It differs from insertMarkupTags(ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.JSourceCodeEditor, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) in two ways. First it is not a reversible modal transformation: if the selection is already surrounded by the suffix and prefix, these are not removed. Second, it is possible to indicate a desired character range to be selected after the insertion. This is done by including the sequences $| (start of selection) and |$ (end of selection) within the prefix and suffix. The sequences themselves are deleted prior to inserting the text. If the sequences appear multiple times in suffix and/or prefix, then the selection is determined by the occurrence closest to the end of the final string (the concatenation of suffix, selection, and prefix), although all copies of the sequences are deleted. Instances of either sequence that occur within the selection are ignored. Note: the correctness of this method relies on the fact that lines are always indicated by the \n character (only).

      For example, the following would convert the selection into a JavaScript function body and select the text "name" so that the user can type the function name to complete the function: 

      insertBracketingText( editor, "function $|name|$() {\n", "\n}" );
      Parameters:
      editor -
      prefix -
      suffix -

    • removeBracketingText

      public static void removeBracketingText​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, String prefix, String suffix)
      If the selection is surrounded by prefix and suffix, then those strings are deleted. The prefix and suffix may either be part of the selection or immediately outside of it.
      Parameters:
      editor - the editor to modify text within
      prefix - the prefix to remove
      suffix - the suffix to remove

    • insertMarkupTags

      public static void insertMarkupTags​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, String prefix, String suffix)
      An action helper that inserts "tags" around the selected text, such as "<b>" and "</b>". The tags may consist of any text, not just actual SGML/HTML/XML-style markup. This is a reversible, modal transformation: if the selection is already surrounded by the prefix and suffix (either as part of the selection or immediately before and after the selection), the prefix and suffix are deleted from the document. Note: the correctness of this method relies on the fact that lines are always indicated by the \n character (only).
      Parameters:
      editor -
      prefix -
      suffix -

    • selectWordUnderCursor

      public static void selectWordUnderCursor​(JSourceCodeEditor editor)

    • getSelectedLines

      public static int[] getSelectedLines​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, boolean doNotIncludeLineIfCaretAtStart)
      An action helper that returns the line range covered by the selection, in increasing order of line number.
      Parameters:
      editor - the editor to get lines from
      doNotIncludeLineIfCaretAtStart - if the selection ends at offset 0 within a line (i.e., it immediately follows a newline), then the line that includes the selection end will not be included
      Returns:
      the lines covered by the selection, as a pair of integers, lowest line first

    • selectLines

      public static void selectLines​(JSourceCodeEditor editor)
      Extends the current selection to cover the entirety of the line(s) that they span.
      Parameters:
      editor - the editor to expand the line selection within

    • selectLines

      public static void selectLines​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, int startLine, int endLine)
      Selects the specified range of lines.
      Parameters:
      editor - the editor to select lines in
      startLine - the first line to select
      endLine - the last line to select

    • getSelectedLineText

      public static String[] getSelectedLineText​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, boolean doNotIncludeLineIfCaretAtStart)
      An action helper that returns the selected lines as an array of strings.
      Parameters:
      editor - the editor to get lines from
      doNotIncludeLineIfCaretAtStart - if the selection ends at offset 0 within a line (i.e., it immediately follows a newline), then the line that includes the selection end will not be included
      Returns:
      the text of the lines covered by the selection, one line per element

    • setSelectedLineText

      public static int setSelectedLineText​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, String[] lines, int length)

      public static String[] getClipboardLines​(JSourceCodeEditor editor)

    • getClipboardText

      public static String getClipboardText​(JSourceCodeEditor editor)

    • replaceSelection

      public static void replaceSelection​(JSourceCodeEditor editor, String text)
      Equivalent to editor.setSelection(), but if there was an existing selection that will be replaced, then the newly inserted text will be selected.
      Parameters:
      editor -
      text -

    • findEditor

      public static JSourceCodeEditor findEditor​(EventObject evt)
      Returns the text area that fired the specified event.
      Parameters:
      evt - The event
